basics.name: Muhammad Nabeel Amin
basics.summary: Innovative Software Engineer and AI Researcher with 4+ years of expertise in building high-impact machine learning, computer vision, and data analytics solutions. Proven ability to deliver scalable Python-based AI applications, achieving over 90% accuracy and driving operational efficiency by 40%+. Skilled at transforming complex data into strategic insights using advanced analytics and visualisation tools. Passionate about advancing AI through research and practical, results-driven software development.

work.summary: Delivered end-to-end AI solutions using Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and YOLOv5/OpenCV for ML/DL and computer vision tasks, achieving up to 92% model accuracy and 80% task automation. Engineered scalable data pipelines and built real-time dashboards with Tableau and Power BI, improving data accessibility and reducing processing time by 60%.

Instructed over 100+ students in Python programming and foundational AI concepts through interactive, project-based learning. Coached students in building real-world applications using PyGame and Turtle, fostering creativity and practical problem-solving skills.

Led applied AI research in Computer Vision and Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for precision agriculture, designing models tailored for crop classification and yield prediction. Achieved 99.7% training accuracy using optimized CNN architectures, significantly enhancing model performance on agricultural datasets.

Led the development of a 3D medical image segmentation pipeline using U-Net architecture with TensorFlow, achieving precise region mapping and reducing diagnostic processing time. Optimized computational efficiency and resource usage by 12% across multiple computer vision projects, leveraging tools such as OpenCV, Keras, and CUDA-enabled acceleration.

Designed and implemented a facial recognition system using Python and OpenCV, focusing on real-time detection and identity verification. Enhanced model performance by 90% through advanced feature extraction techniques, including facial landmark detection and histogram-based filtering.

education.area: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (BSCS)
courses: Thesis: AI-Driven Privacy Preservation in Real-Time Video Surveillance
